ground_truth.dataUseSummary: This dataset is governed by managed access requirements. Access requests are reviewed and approved by designated team administrators. Researchers who want to use this data should submit an access request through Synapse, which will be reviewed by the access management team.

  "hasAccessRequirements": null,
  "aclSummary": [],
  "dataUseSummary": "I was unable to retrieve the access‑requirement information for dataset **syn22314856** because the repository APIs require authentication (an authorized Synapse session token). Without a valid token the POST /restrictionInformation and GET /accessRequirement/{id}/acl endpoints will not return data. \n\nTo obtain the ACL details you (or a user with appropriate privileges) should:\n1. Log in to Synapse (https://www.synapse.org) and generate a personal access token (PAT) under *Settings → Personal Access Tokens*.\n2. Use that token in the HTTP Authorization header (e.g., `Authorization: Bearer <your‑PAT>`) when calling the two API endpoints:\n   - `POST https://repo-prod.prod.sagebase.org/repo/v1/restrictionInformation` with body `{ \"objectId\": \"syn22314856\", \"restrictableObjectType\": \"ENTITY\" }`\n   - For each returned `requirementId`, call `GET https://repo-prod.prod.sagebase.org/repo/v1/accessRequirement/{requirementId}/acl`\n3. Review the returned ACLs; they list the principal IDs (users or teams) that have `READ`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, etc., permissions on the access‑requirement object. Those principals are the individuals or governance teams that manage access requests for the dataset.\n\n**What this means for researchers:**\n- Before requesting the data you should first identify the managing team or user (typically a Data Access Committee, Study Team, or Data Custodian) from the ACL results.\n- Contact that team via the email address or communication channel listed on the dataset’s Synapse page (often found under the \"Data Use\" or \"Request Access\" section) to ask about the required data‑use agreements, IRB approvals, and any other conditions.\n- Once you have the appropriate approvals, you will submit a request through Synapse, where the identified managers will review and approve (or deny) your request.\n\nIf you need assistance obtaining a PAT or making the API calls, please let me know and I can provide step‑by‑step instructions."
}
